intro: Tanacetopsis czukavinae, commonly known as the Czukavina's tansy, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists studying alpine flora. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it a valuable subject for conservation and taxonomic research.
